title: Connected Subsets
content: The collection of all connected subsets of a topological space X. A set is connected if it cannot be partitioned into two disjoint non-empty open sets.

title: Connected Subsets of S
content: The set of all connected subsets contained within a given set S. This is what we count to address Erd≈ës's second question about cardinality.

title: Homeomorphic Sets
content: Two sets are homeomorphic if there exists a continuous bijection with continuous inverse between them (with subspace topology). This captures 'topologically equivalent' structure.

title: Diverse Connected Subset
content: A set S has 'diverse' structure if it contains a proper connected subset T that is (1) not a single point, and (2) not homeomorphic to S itself. Erd≈ës expected all connected sets to have this property.

title: Erd≈ës's First Conjecture
content: Every connected set has a diverse connected subset. Erd≈ës believed connected sets should have rich internal structure with 'genuinely different' proper subsets.

title: Connected Subset Cardinality
content: The cardinal number counting how many connected subsets a set has. For typical sets this is 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ (the continuum), but Erd≈ës asked if it's always strictly larger.

title: The Continuum
content: The cardinality of ‚Ñù, denoted 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ or ùî†. This is the 'size' of the real numbers. Under CH, this equals ‚Ñµ‚ÇÅ.

title: Erd≈ës's Second Conjecture
content: Every connected set in ‚Ñù‚Åø (n ‚â• 2) has more than 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ connected subsets. This would mean connected sets are 'very rich' in structure.

title: Continuum Hypothesis
content: CH states ‚Ñµ‚ÇÅ = 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ: there's no cardinality strictly between the naturals and reals. Rudin's construction requires this axiom, which is independent of ZFC.

title: Rudin Set
content: A connected set where every proper connected subset is either a single point or homeomorphic to the whole. This 'self-similar' structure means no diverse subsets exist.

title: Exactly Continuum Subsets
content: A Rudin set has exactly 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ connected subsets‚Äînot more. This directly contradicts Erd≈ës's second conjecture.

title: Rudin's Theorem
content: Under CH, there exists a connected subset of ‚Ñù¬≤ that is a Rudin set with exactly 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ connected subsets. This is the key existence result providing the counterexample.

title: Rudin Sets Have No Diverse Subsets
content: If S is a Rudin set, then every proper connected subset is either a point or homeomorphic to S. Thus no 'diverse' subset exists, directly contradicting Erd≈ës's first conjecture.

title: First Conjecture False
content: Under CH, Erd≈ës's first conjecture fails: the Rudin set is a connected set without any diverse connected subsets.

title: Second Conjecture False
content: Under CH, Erd≈ës's second conjecture fails: the Rudin set has exactly 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ connected subsets, not more than 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ.
